You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

translation.title: Five Discourses on Not Examining Form, Etc.

next.name: Five Discourses on Not Scrutinizing Form, Etc.

previous.name: Five Discourses on Not Differentiating Form, Etc.

segments.en: 41–45. Five Discourses on Not Examining Form, Etc.

segments.pli: “Rūpe kho, vaccha, asamapekkhaṇā … pe … viññāṇe kho, vaccha, asamapekkhaṇā … pe ….
segments.en: “Vaccha, it is because of not examining form …”

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Vacchagotta asks the Buddha why the various speculative views come to be. The Buddha replies that it is because of not examining the five aggregates.
suttaplex.translated_title: Five Discourses on Not Examining Form, Etc.

translations.author: Bhikkhu Sujato
translations.title: Five Discourses on Not Examining Form, Etc.
